result.execSummary:
The defendant Thanh Kiem Truong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Court advised the defendasnt that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election unti his civil rights have been restored.
Provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge. To be  collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 8/15/18.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Probation to commence after count one sentence.

miscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess  a firearm or body armor; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
Fine of $400.00 inclusive of all mandatory fees, costs and DNA surcharges.  To be paid from 25% of prison wages from DOC by 4/15/18 or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendasnt.

received and filed from Attorney Winter.
Return of property hearing on February 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
MPD Inventory #NONE PROVIDED.
Court signed decision and order denying request for sentence modification from the defendant. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request to modify sentence to concurrent disposition.

Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT TWO:  

  Statements by state, defense counsel and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  SIX YEARS  with ZERO days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is THREE YEARS  the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE YEARS.  Court finds defendant is  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or Earned Release program.  
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on FOUR  YEARS probation to commence after count one sentence.  Conditions of probation:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Provide DNA sample.
*Pay A FINE IN THE AMOUNT OF $400.00 INCLUSIVE  all mandatory  fees,  costs and DNA  surcharges from 25% of prison wages from department of corrections  by 4-15-18 or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 
*no affilation with any gangs
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm OR BODY ARMOR. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

Defendant Thanh Kiem Truong in court with attorney Paul E. Sicula.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT ONE:   Sentencing Proceeded. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons forTWO YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of ONE  YEAR/ SIX MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of SIX MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 08-15-18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-15-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thanh Kiem Truong in court with attorney Paul E. Sicula.  Defendant Thanh Kiem Truong in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Suppression motion proceeded. Sworn in for the State: Officer Patrick Coe. Exhibit 1 received . Sworn in for the State:  Zachary Burczyk. State rests subject to rebuttal. Sworn in for the Defense:  Thanh T. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Cause argued. Court denied defense motion to suppress.

Defendant Thanh Kiem Truong in court with attorney Paul E Sicula.  Defendant Thanh Kiem Truong in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.     No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Thanh Kiem Truong in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Thanh Kiem Truong in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
